channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No road or pavement cleaning in for months, 28th December
item.description:
There has been no road or pavement cleaning in Hilldrop by road for months. Bromleys own cleaning schedule is not being adhered to. The street is looking very scruffy due to litter blown from uncovered green boxes ,and bin men not picking up dropped rubbish on collection day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hilldrop Road, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders waste, 28th December
item.description:
Someone has left a number of rubble sacks stacked up outside the wheelie bin store, but they will not be touched regular bin collection operatives. The person responsible ought to take them to the tip, but has just lef them there for over a week now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Madron Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Broken paving slabs, 28th December
item.description:
All the paving slabs are broken down Felton Lea causing a danger and trip hazard for the elderly and vulnerable. We have a registered disabled foster daughter who uses a wheelchair when needed and this is starting to be an issue, she has also tripped twice already.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Felton Lea, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Asbestos on the street, 28th December
item.description:
People are using a piece of unkept land as a rubbish tip - some sort of hoarding needs to be built to discourage fly tipping, as it is spilling into the street and it's taking weeks or months to clear. There are full sheets of corrugated asbestos, which is a highly hazardous material! There needs to be some sort of deterrant such as CCTV and fines, as this is a main avenue for school children. Please, please, find a permanent solution for this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Madron Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unclear left-turn traffic signal causing recurring congestion, 28th December
item.description:
At the junction by Stockwell Tube Station, the left-turn traffic signal onto Stockwell Road is unclear to approaching drivers. The visibility and/or phasing of the left-turn green signal is ambiguous, resulting in drivers remaining stationary when a green aspect is displayed. This regularly causes vehicles to fail to move during the permitted phase, leading to queueing through the junction, blocked approaches and unnecessary congestion. The issue appears to be signal clarity and layout rather than driver behaviour. Request a review of the signal visibility, positioning and phasing for the left-turn movement, including consideration of improved signal placement, clearer markings and amended signal timing to make the permitted movement obvious to drivers. Location: Stockwell Tube Station junction, left turn onto Stockwell Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2A-2D, Binfield Road, Stockwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
